main event: A luminous object was observed over the island of Kauai, Hawaii on October 7, 1950.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 20 minutes,The observer initially thought it was a shooting star but discounted this due to its slow speed and constant brightness,The object appeared about 25 degrees above the horizon and was estimated to be six times the diameter of the moon when first seen,It moved across the horizon from south to north while maintaining a relatively consistent elevation,There was no reported physical evidence or photographs associated with the sighting.
